results.title: Fitting and machining
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
A qualified fitter and machinist may go on to become a toolmaker, a works foreman or a draughtsman, or he may rise to executive level in a company. The status of professional engineeer can be achieved by those who complete a diploma course. Shows tradesmen at work with various mechanical tools, such as the lathe, grinder and milling machine.

results.title: Casino royale
results.creator_credit: Robert Parrish, Joseph McGrath, Ken Hughes, Val Guest, John Huston, Jerry Bresler, Charles K. Feldman and Famous Artists Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The greatest spy in history, Sir James Bond, has long since retired. The stuttering super spy now content with his garden and afternoons of classical music. His legend has lived on with his namesakes populating the continent, only of late, 11 of them have disappeared under dubious circumstances. Sir James (David Niven) is reluctantly brought out of retirement after the demise of M (John Huston) and faces fierce opposition in the form of an army of beautiful women but manages to make it back to MI5. Once there, he implements an anti-female spy device but he too is captured by SMERSH. A further measure includes naming all spies, including the girls, James Bond 007, to throw the opposition off the scent. Bond blackmails the beautiful Vesper Lynd (Bond regular Ursula Andress) to use her feminine wiles on Baccarat champion Evelyn Tremble (Peter Sellers) to defeat Le Chiffre (Orson Welles) who is bankrolling the activities of SMERSH. Notable cameos include Woody Allen as Jimmy Bond, James’ neurotic nephew lost in the Caribbean and Deborah Kerr as French spy Mimi. Whilst based on an Ian Fleming novel, “Casino royale” was the only Bond novel not sold to Eon Productions and it was deemed that the only film to rival a true Bond film was a parody. The effect was met with mixed reviews and the film does suffer from having five directors at the helm. However, scenes involving Peter Sellers are particularly entertaining. Soundtrack by Burt Bacharach.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Parrish, Joseph McGrath, Ken Hughes, Val Guest, John Huston, Jerry Bresler, Charles K. Feldman and Famous Artists Productions

His legend has lived on with his namesakes populating the continent, only of late, 11 of them have disappeared under dubious circumstances. Sir James (David Niven) is reluctantly brought out of retirement after the demise of M (John Huston) and faces fierce opposition in the form of an army of beautiful women but manages to make it back to MI5. Once there, he implements an anti-female spy device but he too is captured by SMERSH. A further measure includes naming all spies, including the girls, James Bond 007, to throw the opposition off the scent. Bond blackmails the beautiful Vesper Lynd (Bond regular Ursula Andress) to use her feminine wiles on Baccarat champion Evelyn Tremble (Peter Sellers) to defeat Le Chiffre (Orson Welles) who is bankrolling the activities of SMERSH. description_for_label:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The greatest spy in history, Sir James Bond, has long since retired. The stuttering super spy now content with his garden and afternoons of classical music. His legend has lived on with his namesakes populating the continent, only of late, 11 of them have disappeared under dubious circumstances. Sir James (David Niven) is reluctantly brought out of retirement after the demise of M (John Huston) and faces fierce opposition in the form of an army of beautiful women but manages to make it back to MI5. Once there, he implements an anti-female spy device but he too is captured by SMERSH. A further measure includes naming all spies, including the girls, James Bond 007, to throw the opposition off the scent. Bond blackmails the beautiful Vesper Lynd (Bond regular Ursula Andress) to use her feminine wiles on Baccarat champion Evelyn Tremble (Peter Sellers) to defeat Le Chiffre (Orson Welles) who is bankrolling the activities of SMERSH. Whilst based on an Ian Fleming novel, “Casino royale” was the only Bond novel not sold to Eon Productions and it was deemed that the only film to rival a true Bond film was a parody. The effect was met with mixed reviews and the film does suffer from having five directors at the helm. However, scenes involving Peter Sellers are particularly entertaining. results.title: Economics
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The economist is presented as a sort of management advisor to business or government. Outlines what is meant by “forces in the economy” through the activities of people. It then becomes possible to suggest the need for an understanding of these “forces” so that they may be kept operating satisfactorily. The role of the economist in business is shown.

results.title: A View to a kill (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
With a pre-title sequence involving impressive Arctic down hill skiing cum snowboarding (complete with a Beach Boys track), “A View to a kill” marks the final appearance of Roger Moore as Secret Agent 007. When the body of 003 is found concealed beneath the ice, he has in his possession a precious microchip - one impervious to the magnetic force of a nuclear explosion. What’s special about the chip however is that the KGB chip is a perfect replica of one designed in the West by Zorin Industries; someone has been leaking secrets to the Soviets. Head of the industry is Frenchman Max Zorin (a fiendish Christopher Walken who revels in his villainous persona), ably assisted by his right hand “man” May Day (Grace Jones). Zorin’s plan is to take a stranglehold of the International microchip cartel by ridding himself of rival manufacturers - mainly contained within California’s Silicone Valley - thanks to a series of strategically placed explosions along the San Andreas Fault. James goes after Zorin in a trans-continental journey from England to France then America where the film climaxes in a blimp over the Golden Gate Bridge. Notable action sequences include an Eiffel Tower chase, a deadly car wash, a competitive steeplechase and a fiery elevator and fire engine. Tanya Roberts stars as Bond girl seismologist Stacey Sutton.

results.title: Commercial art
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Several years of full-time study requiring imagination, patience and the ability to express ideas in words, as well as in pictures. Stresses that even after training, a job may be hard to find. Shows a young artist in an advertising agency learning to accept criticism of simple jobs, before moving on to more demanding work.

results.title: On Her Majesty's secret service
results.creator_credit: Peter Hunt, Harry Saltzman, Albert R. Broccoli and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
Bond is approached by a crime boss to marry his widowed daughter, Tracy, after hearing of the good deeds that Bond has demonstrated in saving his suicidal child. The father offers one million pounds, Bond asks for the location of Ernst Blofeld (Telly Savalas), head of SPECTRE in return. Disguised as a (kilted) genealogist with the College of Arms, Bond travels to Blofeld’s Alpine residence to discuss investigation into whether Blofeld is a legitimate count. Once there, Bond stumbles across a bizarre scene in which he dines with a room containing a bevy of beautiful women eating only one type of food. This is part of their treatment at Blofeld’s allergy treatment clinic that also includes late night brain-washing. The clinic is a sinister front - Blofeld is planning a bacteriological war. Features a car rally on ice with Diana Rigg in the driver’s seat, and plenty of down hill skiing and other snow-related action. In a departure from most Bond films, Bond (George Lazenby in his only performance as 007) actually falls for the girl, confessing his love and proposing, surviving a brief but ultimately tragic marriage.

results.title: Chemical engineering
results.creator_credit: Mutual Film Corporation and Career Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
The chemical engineer applies engineering principles for chemical purposes, and works with the chemist and mechanical engineer. The design, erection and economical operation of chemical plants is his responsibility. He may have to analyse much data and prepare reports on plant operation. His grasp of maths must be strong and the computer is one of his tools. The university course indicates the wide field covered by his training.

results.title: Licence to kill (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The happy nuptials of James’ CIA buddy Felix Leiter (David Hedison) and bride-to-be Della are rudely interrupted when they embark on a mercy dash to capture drug lord Franz Sanchez (Robert Davi). Thanks to some aerial fishing though, their mission is successful and the parachuting groomsmen make it in time for the wedding. The happy couple are soon devastated however when Sanchez escapes and kills the bride and maims the groom as payback. This triggers best buddy James (Timothy Dalton) to relinquish his secret service status and licence to kill authority (Bond is under orders to complete another mission) as he embarks on a personal vendetta to revenge Sanchez’s brutality towards his friends. Ably assisted by ex-Army pilot Pam Bouvier (Carey Lowell), Bond flies into Isthmus City to infiltrate himself into Sanchez’s posse where he discovers a television evangelist (Wayne Newton) providing a front for cocaine dealing. Featuring a plethora of water inspired stunts earlier on in the film, the cast also includes Benicio Del Toro as a brooding henchman and Talisa Soto as Lupe Lamore, Sanchez’s mistress, eye candy, and source of jealousy for Bouvier. This was Timothy Dalton’s last appearance as Bond.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Glen, Michael G. Wilson, Albert R. Broccoli, United Artists Corporation and Danjaq

Thanks to some aerial fishing though, their mission is successful and the parachuting groomsmen make it in time for the wedding. The happy couple are soon devastated however when Sanchez escapes and kills the bride and maims the groom as payback. This triggers best buddy James (Timothy Dalton) to relinquish his secret service status and licence to kill authority (Bond is under orders to complete another mission) as he embarks on a personal vendetta to revenge Sanchez’s brutality towards his friends. Ably assisted by ex-Army pilot Pam Bouvier (Carey Lowell), Bond flies into Isthmus City to infiltrate himself into Sanchez’s posse where he discovers a television evangelist (Wayne Newton) providing a front for cocaine dealing. Featuring a plethora of water inspired stunts earlier on in the film, the cast also includes Benicio Del Toro as a brooding henchman and Talisa Soto as Lupe Lamore, Sanchez’s mistress, eye candy, and source of jealousy for Bouvier. This was Timothy Dalton’s last appearance as Bond.
description_for_label:
Episode of Series “James Bond”.
The happy nuptials of James’ CIA buddy Felix Leiter (David Hedison) and bride-to-be Della are rudely interrupted when they embark on a mercy dash to capture drug lord Franz Sanchez (Robert Davi). Thanks to some aerial fishing though, their mission is successful and the parachuting groomsmen make it in time for the wedding. The happy couple are soon devastated however when Sanchez escapes and kills the bride and maims the groom as payback. This triggers best buddy James (Timothy Dalton) to relinquish his secret service status and licence to kill authority (Bond is under orders to complete another mission) as he embarks on a personal vendetta to revenge Sanchez’s brutality towards his friends. Ably assisted by ex-Army pilot Pam Bouvier (Carey Lowell), Bond flies into Isthmus City to infiltrate himself into Sanchez’s posse where he discovers a television evangelist (Wayne Newton) providing a front for cocaine dealing. Featuring a plethora of water inspired stunts earlier on in the film, the cast also includes Benicio Del Toro as a brooding henchman and Talisa Soto as Lupe Lamore, Sanchez’s mistress, eye candy, and source of jealousy for Bouvier. This was Timothy Dalton’s last appearance as Bond.
